entries.title: Tesla Stock Falls 12%, Posting Worst Drop in Over Two Years
entries.description: Wall Street resets 2023 vehicle-delivery expectations after last year’s numbers fell short.

entries.title: Microsoft Workers to Form Company's First Union in the U.S.
entries.description: Around 300 employees at the software company’s videogame unit ZeniMax have voted to organize with the Communications Workers of America.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Pleads Not Guilty to Fraud and Other Offenses
entries.description: The FTX founder faces eight criminal counts, including conspiracies to commit securities fraud and commodities fraud.

entries.title: Nvidia, Foxconn Partner on Electric Vehicles
entries.description: Foxconn will produce and use Nvidia’s chips that help enable autonomous driving.

entries.title: Google and Meta's Advertising Dominance Fades as TikTok, Streamers Emerge
entries.description: For the first time in nearly a decade, Google and Meta—the two largest players in online advertising—are no longer taking in the majority of U.S. digital-ad dollars.

entries.title: IRS Sees Crypto Companies as Potential Crime-Fighting Partners
entries.description: A top official in the IRS’s law-enforcement arm said the agency wants to build ties with the digital-assets sector

entries.title: Fintech Stocks Did Worse Than Fin or Tech in 2022
entries.description: A vulnerability to higher interest rates and a reckoning over growth-at-all-costs playbooks contributed to many fintech firms’ fall from grace.

entries.title: Gadget Makers Face an Innovation Crunch as CES 2023 Kicks Off
entries.description: The Las Vegas megashow returns Jan. 5—with fewer startups bearing wacky products.

entries.title: Tech Layoffs Are Happening Faster Than at Any Time During the Pandemic
entries.description: Areas that were largely spared in 2020 are now among those with the largest numbers of job cuts.

entries.title: Ukraine Has Digitized Its Fighting Forces on a Shoestring
entries.description: Ukraine has achieved a cut-price version of what the Pentagon has spent decades and billions of dollars striving to accomplish: digitally networked fighters, intelligence and weapons.
